1 /**
  2  * @file network.js
  3  * 
  4  * @brief 
  5  * Links Network is an interactive chart to visualize networks. 
  6  * It allows creating nodes, links between the nodes, and interactive packages 
  7  * moving between nodes. The visualization supports custom styles, colors, 
  8  * sizes, images, and more.
  9  *
 10  * The network visualization works smooth on any modern browser for up to a 
 11  * few hundred nodes and connections.
 12  * 
 13  * Network is developed as a Google Visualization Chart in javascript. 
 14  * There is a GWT wrapper available to use the Network in GWT (Google Web 
 15  * Toolkit). It runs on all modern browsers without additional requirements. 
 16  * Network is tested on Firefox 3.6+, Safari 5.0+, Chrome 6.0+, Opera 10.6+, 
 17  * Internet Explorer 9+.
 18  * 
 19  * Links Network is part of the CHAP Links library.

 42 
 43 internally rename radiusMin to widthMin and radiusMax to widthMax ?
 44   right now the default widthMin and widthMax are not taken in case of an image
 45 solve problem with nodes initially having no velocity, thus not starting animation
 46 let the strength of a link depend on the number of (intermediate) connections
 47 group clusters as one node when zooming out
 48 make a smarter "random" start position for the nodes, based on the links
 49 currently it does not work well to switch from realtime to history animation and vice versa
 50 when adding nodes/links in realtime, they have no nice start position, causing wild movements
 51 when a node is created/replaced/removed, adjust all references in the defined links and packages 
 52 setting the length of links extra long does not result in nice looking network... repulsion should be changed too. 
 53   Or better: repulsion must be stronger than gravity

 56 /**
 57  * Declare a unique namespace for CHAP's Common Hybrid Visualisation Library,
 58  * "links"
 59  */ 
 60 if (typeof links === 'undefined') {
 61   links = {};
 62   // important: do not use var, as "var links = {};" will overwrite 
 63   //            the existing links variable value with undefined in IE8, IE7.  
 64 }
 65 
 66 
 67 /**
 68  * Ensure the variable google exists
 69  */ 
 70 if (typeof google === 'undefined') {
 71   google = undefined; 
 72   // important: do not use var, as "var google = undefined;" will overwrite 
 73   //            the existing google variable value with undefined in IE8, IE7.
 74 }

 77 /**
 78  * @class
 79  * 
 80  * <p>
 81  * Links Network is an interactive chart to visualize networks. 
 82  * It allows creating nodes, links between the nodes, and interactive packages 
 83  * moving between nodes. The visualization supports custom styles, colors, 
 84  * sizes, images, and more.
 85  * </p>
 86  * <p>
 87  * The network visualization works smooth on any modern browser for up to a 
 88  * few hundred nodes and connections.
 89  * </p>
 90  * <p>Network is developed as a Google Visualization Chart in javascript. 
 91  * There is a GWT wrapper available to use the Network in GWT (Google Web 
 92  * Toolkit). It runs on all modern browsers without additional requirements. 
 93  * Network is tested on Firefox 3.6+, Safari 5.0+, Chrome 6.0+, Opera 10.6+, 
 94  * Internet Explorer 9+.
 95  * </p>
 96  * 
 97  * Usage:
 98  * <code><pre>
 99  *   var nodesTable = new google.visualization.DataTable();
100  *   nodesTable.addColumn('number', 'id');
101  *   nodesTable.addColumn('string', 'text');
102  *   nodesTable.addRow([1, "Node 1"]);
103  *   nodesTable.addRow([2, "Node 2"]);
104  *   // ...
105  *
106  *   var linksTable = new google.visualization.DataTable();
107  *   linksTable.addColumn('number', 'from');
108  *   linksTable.addColumn('number', 'to');
109  *   linksTable.addRow([1, 2]);   
110  *
111  *   var packageTable = undefined; 
112  * 
113  *   var network = new links.Network(document.getElementById('network'));
114  *   network.draw(nodesTable, linksTable, packagesTable, options);
115  * </pre></code>
116  * <br>
117  * 
118  * @param {dom_element} container   The DOM element in which the Network will
119  *                                  be created. Normally a div element.
120  */
121 links.Network = function(container) {
122   // create variables and set default values
123   this.containerElement = container;
124   this.width = "100%";
125   this.height = "100%";
126   this.refreshRate = 50; // milliseconds
127   this.stabilize = true; // stabilize before displaying the network
128   this.selectable = true;
129   
130   // set constant values
131   this.constants = {
132     "nodes": {
133       "radiusMin": 5,
134       "radiusMax": 20,
135       "radius": 5,
136       "distance": 100, // px
137       "style": "rect",
138       "image": undefined,       
139       "widthMin": 16, // px
140       "widthMax": 64, // px
141       "fontColor": "black",
142       "fontSize": 14, // px
143       //"fontFace": "verdana",
144       "fontFace": "arial",
145       "borderColor": "#2B7CE9", 
146       "backgroundColor": "#97C2FC", 
147       "highlightColor": "#D2E5FF",
148       "group": undefined
149     },
150     "links": {
151       "widthMin": 1,
152       "widthMax": 15,
153       "width": 1,
154       "style": "line",
155       "color": "#2B7CE9",
156       "length": 100   // px
157     },
158     "packages": {
159       "radius": 5,
160       "radiusMin": 5, 
161       "radiusMax": 10,
162       "style": "dot",
163       "color": "#2B7CE9",
164       "image": undefined, 
165       "widthMin": 16, // px
166       "widthMax": 64, // px
167       "duration": 1.0   // seconds
168     },
169     "minVelocity": 0.01,   // px/s
170     "maxIterations": 1000  // maximum number of iteration to stabilize
171   };
172 
173   this.nodes = [];     // array with Node objects
174   this.links = [];     // array with Link objects
175   this.packages = [];  // array with all Package packages
176   this.images = new links.Network.Images();     // object with images
177   this.groups = new links.Network.Groups();     // object with groups
178 
179   // properties of the data
180   this.hasMovingLinks = false;    // True if one or more of the links or nodes have an animation
181   this.hasMovingNodes = false;    // True if any of the nodes have an undefined position
182   this.hasMovingPackages = false; // True if there are one or more packages
183 
184   this.timer = undefined; 
185 
186   // create a frame and canvas
187   this._create();
188 }
189 
190 /** 
191  * Main drawing logic. This is the function that needs to be called 
192  * in the html page, to draw the Network.
193  * Note that Object DataTable is defined in google.visualization.DataTable
194  * 
195  * A data table with the events must be provided, and an options table. 
196  * @param {DataTable or Array}      nodes     The data containing the nodes. 
197  *                                            Optional.
198  * @param {DataTable or Array}      links     The data containing the links.
199  *                                            Optional
200  * @param {DataTable or Array}      packages  The data containing the packages 
201  *                                            Optional.
202  * @param {name/value map} options  A name/value map containing settings
203  */
204 links.Network.prototype.draw = function(nodes, links, packages, options) {
205   // correctly read the parameters. links and packages are optional.
206   if (options != undefined) {
207     var nodesTable = nodes;
208     var linksTable = links; 
209     var packagesTable = packages; 
210   }
211   else if (packages != undefined) {
212     var nodesTable = nodes;
213     var linksTable = links; 
214     var packagesTable = undefined; 
215     options = packages; 
216   }
217   else if (links != undefined) {
218     var nodesTable = nodes;
219     var linksTable = undefined; 
220     var packagesTable = undefined; 
221     options = links; 
222   }  
223   else if (nodes != undefined) {
224     var nodesTable = undefined;
225     var linksTable = undefined; 
226     var packagesTable = undefined; 
227     options = nodes; 
228   }  
229 
230   if (options != undefined) {
231     // retrieve parameter values
232     if (options.width != undefined)           this.width = options.width; 
233     if (options.height != undefined)          this.height = options.height; 
234     if (options.stabilize != undefined)       this.stabilize = options.stabilize; 
235     if (options.selectable != undefined)      this.selectable = options.selectable; 
236     
237     // TODO: work out these options and document them
238     if (options.links) {
239       for (prop in options.links) {
240         if (options.links.hasOwnProperty(prop)) {
241           this.constants.links[prop] = options.links[prop];
242         }
243       }
244         
245       if (options.links.length != undefined && options.links.distance == undefined) {
246         this.constants.links.length   = options.links.length; 
247         this.constants.nodes.distance = options.links.length * 1.25; 
248       }
249     }
250     if (options.nodes) {
251       for (prop in options.nodes) {
252         if (options.nodes.hasOwnProperty(prop)) {
253           this.constants.nodes[prop] = options.nodes[prop];
254         }
255       }
256       
257       /*
258       if (options.nodes.widthMin) this.constants.nodes.radiusMin = options.nodes.widthMin;
259       if (options.nodes.widthMax) this.constants.nodes.radiusMax = options.nodes.widthMax;
260       */
261     }
262     if (options.packages) {
263       for (prop in options.packages) {
264         if (options.packages.hasOwnProperty(prop)) {
265           this.constants.packages[prop] = options.packages[prop];
266         }
267       }
268 
269       /*
270       if (options.packages.widthMin) this.constants.packages.radiusMin = options.packages.widthMin;
271       if (options.packages.widthMax) this.constants.packages.radiusMax = options.packages.widthMax;
272       */ 
273     }
274     
275     if (options.groups) {
276       for (groupname in options.groups) {
277         if (options.groups.hasOwnProperty(groupname)) {
278           var group = options.groups[groupname];
279           this.groups.add(groupname, group);
280         }
281       }
282     }    
283   }
284 
285   this._setBackgroundColor(options.backgroundColor);
286 
287   this._setSize(this.width, this.height);
288   this._setTranslation(0, 0);
289   this._setScale(1.0);
290 
291   // set all data
292   this.hasTimestamps = false;
293   this.setNodes(nodesTable);
294   this.setLinks(linksTable);  
295   this.setPackages(packagesTable);
296   
297   this._reposition(); // TODO: bad solution  
298   if (this.stabilize) {
299     this._doStabilize();
300   }
301   this.start();
302 
303   // create an onload callback method for the images
304   var network = this;
305   var callback = function () {
306     network._redraw();
307   }
308   this.images.setOnloadCallback(callback);
309 
310   // fire the ready event
311   this.trigger('ready');    
312 }
313 
314 /**
315  * fire an event
316  * @param {String} event   The name of an event, for example "select" or "ready"
317  * @param {Object} params  Optional object with event parameters
318  */
319 links.Network.prototype.trigger = function (event, params) {
320   // trigger the links event bus
321   links.events.trigger(this, event, params); 
322   
323   // trigger the google event bus
324   if (google && google.visualization && google.visualization.events) {
325     google.visualization.events.trigger(this, event, params);    
326   }
327 }
328 
329   
330 /**
331  * Create the main frame for the Network.
332  * This function is executed once when a Network object is created. The frame
333  * contains a canvas, and this canvas contains all objects like the axis and 
334  * nodes.
335  */
336 links.Network.prototype._create = function () {
337   // remove all elements from the container element.
338   while (this.containerElement.hasChildNodes()) {
339     this.containerElement.removeChild(this.containerElement.firstChild);
340   }
341   
342   this.frame = document.createElement("div");
343   this.frame.className = "network-frame";
344   this.frame.style.position = "relative";
345   this.frame.style.overflow = "hidden";
346   
347   // create the graph canvas (HTML canvas element)
348   this.frame.canvas = document.createElement( "canvas" );
349   this.frame.canvas.style.position = "relative";
350   this.frame.appendChild(this.frame.canvas);
351   if (!this.frame.canvas.getContext) {
352     var noCanvas = document.createElement( "DIV" );
353     noCanvas.style.color = "red";
354     noCanvas.style.fontWeight =  "bold" ;
355     noCanvas.style.padding =  "10px"; 
356     noCanvas.innerHTML =  "Error: your browser does not support HTML canvas"; 
357     this.frame.canvas.appendChild(noCanvas);
358   }
359   
360   // create event listeners
361   var me = this;
362   var onmousedown = function (event) {me._onMouseDown(event);};
363   var onmousemove = function (event) {me._onMouseMoveTitle(event);};
364   var onmousewheel = function (event) {me._onMouseWheel(event);};
365   var ontouchstart = function (event) {me._onTouchStart(event);};
366   links.Network.addEventListener(this.frame.canvas, "mousedown", onmousedown);
367   links.Network.addEventListener(this.frame.canvas, "mousemove", onmousemove);
368   links.Network.addEventListener(this.frame.canvas, "mousewheel", onmousewheel);
369   links.Network.addEventListener(this.frame.canvas, "touchstart", ontouchstart);
370     
371   // add the frame to the container element
372   this.containerElement.appendChild(this.frame); 
373 }
374 
375 /**
376  * Set the background styling for the graph
377  * @param {string or Object} backgroundColor
378  */
379 links.Network.prototype._setBackgroundColor = function(backgroundColor) {
380   var fill = "white";
381   var stroke = "#666";
382   var strokeWidth = 1;
383   
384   if (typeof(backgroundColor) == "string") {
385     fill = backgroundColor;
386     stroke = "none";
387     strokeWidth = 0;
388   }
389   else if (typeof(backgroundColor) == "object") {
390     if (backgroundColor.fill != undefined)        fill = backgroundColor.fill;
391     if (backgroundColor.stroke != undefined)      stroke = backgroundColor.stroke;
392     if (backgroundColor.strokeWidth != undefined) strokeWidth = backgroundColor.strokeWidth;
393   } 
394   else if  (backgroundColor == undefined) {
395     // use use defaults
396   }
397   else {
398     throw "Unsupported type of backgroundColor";
399   }
400 
401   this.frame.style.backgroundColor = fill;
402   this.frame.style.borderColor = stroke;
403   this.frame.style.borderWidth = strokeWidth + "px";
404   this.frame.style.borderStyle = "solid";
405 }
406 
407 
408 /**
409  * handle on mouse down event
410  */ 
411 links.Network.prototype._onMouseDown = function (event) {
412   event = event || window.event;
413   
414   if (!this.selectable)
415     return;
416   
417   // check if mouse is still down (may be up when focus is lost for example
418   // in an iframe)
419   if (this.leftButtonDown) {
420     this._onMouseUp(event);
421   }
422 
423   // only react on left mouse button down
424   this.leftButtonDown = event.which ? (event.which == 1) : (event.button == 1);
425   if (!this.leftButtonDown && !this.touchDown) {
426     return;
427   }
428   
429   // add event listeners to handle moving the contents
430   // we store the function onmousemove and onmouseup in the timeline, so we can
431   // remove the eventlisteners lateron in the function mouseUp()
432   var me = this;
433   this.onmousemove = function (event) {me._onMouseMove(event);};
434   this.onmouseup   = function (event) {me._onMouseUp(event);};
435   
436   links.Network.addEventListener(document, "mousemove", me.onmousemove);
437   links.Network.addEventListener(document, "mouseup", me.onmouseup);
438   links.Network.preventDefault(event);
439   
440   // store the start x and y position of the mouse
441   this.startMouseX = event.clientX || event.targetTouches[0].clientX;
442   this.startMouseY = event.clientY || event.targetTouches[0].clientY;
443   this.startFrameLeft = links.Network._getAbsoluteLeft(this.frame.canvas);
444   this.startFrameTop = links.Network._getAbsoluteTop(this.frame.canvas);
445   this.startTranslation = this._getTranslation();
446 
447   this.ctrlKeyDown = event.ctrlKey;
448   this.shiftKeyDown = event.shiftKey;
449 
450   var obj = {
451     "left" :   this._xToCanvas(this.startMouseX - this.startFrameLeft), 
452     "top" :    this._yToCanvas(this.startMouseY - this.startFrameTop), 
453     "right" :  this._xToCanvas(this.startMouseX - this.startFrameLeft), 
454     "bottom" : this._yToCanvas(this.startMouseY - this.startFrameTop)
455   };
456   var overlappingNodes = this._getNodesOverlappingWith(obj);
457   // if there are overlapping nodes, select the last one, this is the 
458   // one which is drawn on top of the others
459   this.startClickedObj = (overlappingNodes.length > 0) ? 
460     overlappingNodes[overlappingNodes.length - 1] : undefined;
461 
462   if (this.startClickedObj) {
463     // move clicked node with the mouse
464 
465     // make the clicked node temporarily fixed, and store their original state
466     var node = this.nodes[this.startClickedObj.row];
467     this.startClickedObj.xFixed = node.xFixed;
468     this.startClickedObj.yFixed = node.yFixed;
469     node.xFixed = true;
470     node.yFixed = true;
471     
472     if (!this.ctrlKeyDown || !node.isSelected()) {
473       // select this node
474       this._selectNodes([this.startClickedObj], this.ctrlKeyDown);
475     }
476     else {
477       // unselect this node
478       this._unselectNodes([this.startClickedObj]);
479     }
480     
481     if (!this.hasMovingNodes) {
482       this._redraw();
483     }
484   }
485   else if (this.shiftKeyDown) {
486     // start selection of multiple nodes
487   }
488   else {
489     // start moving the graph
490     this.moved = false;
491   }
492 }
493 
494 /**
495  * handle on mouse move event
496  */ 
497 links.Network.prototype._onMouseMove = function (event) {
498   event = event || window.event;
499     
500   if (!this.selectable)
501     return;
502 
503   var mouseX = event.clientX || (event.targetTouches && event.targetTouches[0].clientX) || 0;
504   var mouseY = event.clientY || (event.targetTouches && event.targetTouches[0].clientY) || 0;
505   this.mouseX = mouseX;
506   this.mouseY = mouseY;
507   
508   if (this.startClickedObj) {
509     var node = this.nodes[this.startClickedObj.row];
510     
511     if (!this.startClickedObj.xFixed) 
512       node.x = this._xToCanvas(mouseX - this.startFrameLeft);
513 
514     if (!this.startClickedObj.yFixed) 
515       node.y = this._yToCanvas(mouseY - this.startFrameTop);
516 
517     // start animation if not yet running
518     if (!this.hasMovingNodes) {
519       this.hasMovingNodes = true;
520       this.start();
521     }
522   }
523   else if (this.shiftKeyDown) {
524     // draw a rect from start mouse location to current mouse location
525     if (this.frame.selRect == undefined) {
526       this.frame.selRect = document.createElement("DIV");
527       this.frame.appendChild(this.frame.selRect);
528       
529       this.frame.selRect.style.position = "absolute";
530       this.frame.selRect.style.border = "1px dashed red";
531     }
532   
533     var left =   Math.min(this.startMouseX, mouseX) - this.startFrameLeft;
534     var top =    Math.min(this.startMouseY, mouseY) - this.startFrameTop; 
535     var right =  Math.max(this.startMouseX, mouseX) - this.startFrameLeft; 
536     var bottom = Math.max(this.startMouseY, mouseY) - this.startFrameTop;
537     
538     this.frame.selRect.style.left = left + "px";
539     this.frame.selRect.style.top = top + "px";
540     this.frame.selRect.style.width = (right - left) + "px";
541     this.frame.selRect.style.height = (bottom - top) + "px";
542   }
543   else {
544     // move the network
545     var diffX = mouseX - this.startMouseX;
546     var diffY = mouseY - this.startMouseY;
547 
548     this._setTranslation(
549       this.startTranslation.x + diffX, 
550       this.startTranslation.y + diffY);
551     this._redraw();
552     
553     this.moved = true;
554   }
555 
556   links.Network.preventDefault(event);  
557 }
558 
559 /**
560  * handle on mouse up event
561  */ 
562 links.Network.prototype._onMouseUp = function (event) {
563   event = event || window.event;
564   
565   if (!this.selectable) {
566     return;
567   }
568 
569   // remove event listeners here, important for Safari
570   links.Network.removeEventListener(document, "mousemove", this.onmousemove);
571   links.Network.removeEventListener(document, "mouseup",   this.onmouseup); 
572   links.Network.preventDefault(event);
573 
574   // check selected nodes
575   var endMouseX = event.clientX || this.mouseX || 0;
576   var endMouseY = event.clientY || this.mouseY || 0;
577   
578   var ctrlKey = event ? event.ctrlKey : window.event.ctrlKey;
579 
580   if (this.startClickedObj) {
581     // restore the original fixed state
582     var node = this.nodes[this.startClickedObj.row];
583     node.xFixed = this.startClickedObj.xFixed;
584     node.yFixed = this.startClickedObj.yFixed;
585   }
586   else if (this.shiftKeyDown) {
587     // select nodes inside selection area
588     var obj = {
589       "left":   this._xToCanvas(Math.min(this.startMouseX, endMouseX) - this.startFrameLeft),
590       "top":    this._yToCanvas(Math.min(this.startMouseY, endMouseY) - this.startFrameTop),
591       "right":  this._xToCanvas(Math.max(this.startMouseX, endMouseX) - this.startFrameLeft), 
592       "bottom": this._yToCanvas(Math.max(this.startMouseY, endMouseY) - this.startFrameTop)
593     };
594     var overlappingNodes = this._getNodesOverlappingWith(obj);
595     this._selectNodes(overlappingNodes, ctrlKey);
596     this.redraw();
597 
598     // remove the selection rectangle
599     if (this.frame.selRect) {
600       this.frame.removeChild(this.frame.selRect);
601       this.frame.selRect = undefined;
602     }
603   }
604   else {
605     if (!this.ctrlKeyDown && !this.moved) {
606       // remove selection
607       this._unselectNodes();
608       this._redraw();
609     }
610   }
611   
612   this.leftButtonDown = false;
613   this.ctrlKeyDown = false;
614 }

617 /** 
618  * Event handler for mouse wheel event, used to zoom the timeline
619  * Code from http://adomas.org/javascript-mouse-wheel/
620  * @param {event}  event   The event
621  */
622 links.Network.prototype._onMouseWheel = function(event) {
623   event = event || window.event;
624   var mouseX = event.clientX;
625   var mouseY = event.clientY;
626   
627   // retrieve delta    
628   var delta = 0;
629   if (event.wheelDelta) { /* IE/Opera. */
630     delta = event.wheelDelta/120;
631   } else if (event.detail) { /* Mozilla case. */
632     // In Mozilla, sign of delta is different than in IE.
633     // Also, delta is multiple of 3.
634     delta = -event.detail/3;
635   }
636 
637   // If delta is nonzero, handle it.
638   // Basically, delta is now positive if wheel was scrolled up,
639   // and negative, if wheel was scrolled down.
640   if (delta) {
641     // determine zoom factor, and adjust the zoom factor such that zooming in
642     // and zooming out correspond wich each other
643     var zoom = delta / 10;
644     if (delta < 0) {
645       zoom = zoom / (1 - zoom);
646     }
647     
648     var scaleOld = this._getScale();
649     var scaleNew = scaleOld * (1 + zoom);
650     if (scaleNew < 0.01) {
651       scaleNew = 0.01;
652     }
653     if (scaleNew > 10) {
654       scaleNew = 10;
655     }
656 
657     var frameLeft = links.Network._getAbsoluteLeft(this.frame.canvas);
658     var frameTop = links.Network._getAbsoluteTop(this.frame.canvas);
659     var x = mouseX - frameLeft;
660     var y = mouseY - frameTop;
661     
662     var translation = this._getTranslation();
663     var scaleFrac = scaleNew / scaleOld;
664     var tx = (1 - scaleFrac) * x + translation.x * scaleFrac;
665     var ty = (1 - scaleFrac) * y + translation.y * scaleFrac;
666     
667     this._setScale(scaleNew);
668     this._setTranslation(tx, ty);
669     this._redraw();
670   }
671 
672   // Prevent default actions caused by mouse wheel.
673   // That might be ugly, but we handle scrolls somehow
674   // anyway, so don't bother here...
675   links.Network.preventDefault(event);
676 }
677 
678 
679 /**
680  * Mouse move handler for checking whether the title moves over a node or 
681  * package with a title.
682  */
683 links.Network.prototype._onMouseMoveTitle = function (event) {
684   event = event || window.event;
685   
686   var startMouseX = event.clientX;
687   var startMouseY = event.clientY;
688   this.startFrameLeft = this.startFrameLeft || links.Network._getAbsoluteLeft(this.frame.canvas);
689   this.startFrameTop = this.startFrameTop || links.Network._getAbsoluteTop(this.frame.canvas);
690 
691   var x = startMouseX - this.startFrameLeft;
692   var y = startMouseY - this.startFrameTop;
693 
694   // check if the previously selected node is still selected
695   if (this.popupNode) {
696     this._checkHidePopup(x, y);
697   }
698 
699   // start a timeout that will check if the mouse is positioned above 
700   // an element
701   var me = this;
702   var checkShow = function() {
703     me._checkShowPopup(x, y);
704   }
705   if (this.popupTimer) {
706     clearInterval(this.popupTimer); // stop any running timer
707   }
708   if (!this.leftButtonDown) {
709     this.popupTimer = setTimeout(checkShow, 300);
710   }
711 };
712 
713 /**
714  * Check if there is an element on the given position in the network (
715  * (a node, package, or link). If so, and if this element has a title, 
716  * show a popup window with its title.
717  * 
718  * @param {number} x
719  * @param {number} y
720  */ 
721 links.Network.prototype._checkShowPopup = function (x, y) {
722   var obj = {
723     "left" : this._xToCanvas(x), 
724     "top" : this._yToCanvas(y), 
725     "right" : this._xToCanvas(x), 
726     "bottom" : this._yToCanvas(y)
727   };
728   
729   var lastPopupNode = this.popupNode;
730   
731   if (this.popupNode == undefined) {
732     // search the packages for overlap
733     
734     for (var i = 0, len = this.packages.length; i < len; i++) {
735       var p = this.packages[i];
736       if (p.getTitle() != undefined && p.isOverlappingWith(obj)) {
737         this.popupNode = p;
738         break;
739       }
740     }
741   }
742   
743   if (this.popupNode == undefined) {
744     // search the nodes for overlap, select the top one in case of multiple nodes
745     var nodes = this.nodes;
746     for (var i = nodes.length - 1; i > 0; i--) {
747       var node = nodes[i];
748       if (node.getTitle() != undefined && node.isOverlappingWith(obj)) {
749         this.popupNode = node;
750         break;
751       }
752     }    
753   }
754   
755   if (this.popupNode == undefined) {
756     // search the links for overlap
757     var allLinks = this.links;
758     for (var i = 0, len = allLinks.length; i < len; i++) {
759       var link = allLinks[i];
760       if (link.getTitle() != undefined && link.isOverlappingWith(obj)) {
761         this.popupNode = link;
762         break;
763       }
764     }
765   }
766 
767   if (this.popupNode) {
768     // show popup message window
769     if (this.popupNode != lastPopupNode) {
770       var me = this;
771       if (!me.popup) {
772         me.popup = new links.Network.Popup(me.frame);
773       }
774       
775       // adjust a small offset such that the mouse cursor is located in the
776       // bottom left location of the popup, and you can easily move over the
777       // popup area
778       me.popup.setPosition(x - 3, y - 3);
779       me.popup.setText(me.popupNode.getTitle());
780       me.popup.show();
781     }
782   }
783   else {
784     if (this.popup) {
785       this.popup.hide();
786     }
787   }  
788 }
789 
790 /**
791  * Check if the popup must be hided, which is the case when the mouse is no
792  * longer hovering on the object 
793  * @param {number} x
794  * @param {number} y
795  */ 
796 links.Network.prototype._checkHidePopup = function (x, y) {
797   var obj = {
798     "left" : x, 
799     "top" : y, 
800     "right" : x, 
801     "bottom" : y
802   };
803 
804   if (!this.popupNode || !this.popupNode.isOverlappingWith(obj) ) {
805     this.popupNode = undefined;
806     if (this.popup) {
807       this.popup.hide();
808     }
809   }
810 
811 }

813 /**
814  * Event handler for touchstart event on mobile devices 
815  */ 
816 links.Network.prototype._onTouchStart = function(event) {
817   this.touchDown = true;
818   
819   var me = this;
820   this.ontouchmove = function (event) {me._onTouchMove(event);};
821   this.ontouchend   = function (event) {me._onTouchEnd(event);};
822   links.Network.addEventListener(document, "touchmove", me.ontouchmove);
823   links.Network.addEventListener(document, "touchend", me.ontouchend);
824   
825   this._onMouseDown(event);
826 };

828 /**
829  * Event handler for touchmove event on mobile devices 
830  */ 
831 links.Network.prototype._onTouchMove = function(event) {
832   this._onMouseMove(event);
833 };
834 
835 /**
836  * Event handler for touchend event on mobile devices 
837  */ 
838 links.Network.prototype._onTouchEnd = function(event) {
839   this.touchDown = false;
840 
841   links.Network.removeEventListener(document, "touchmove", this.ontouchmove);
842   links.Network.removeEventListener(document, "touchend",   this.ontouchend); 
843 
844   this._onMouseUp(event);
845 };

848 /**
849  * Unselect selected nodes. If no selection array is provided, all nodes 
850  * are unselected
851  * @param {Array with object}  Array with selection objects, each selection
852  *                             object has a parameter row. Optional
853  * @param {Boolean} triggerSelect  If true (default), the select event 
854  *                                 is triggered when nodes are unselected
855  * @param {Boolean} changed        True if the selection is changed
856  */ 
857 links.Network.prototype._unselectNodes = function(selection, triggerSelect) {
858   var changed = false;
859   
860   if (selection) {
861     // remove provided selections
862     for (var i = 0, iMax = selection.length; i < iMax; i++) {
863       var row = selection[i].row;
864       this.nodes[row].unselect();
865       
866       var j = 0;
867       while (j < this.selection.length) {
868         if (this.selection[j].row == row) {
869           this.selection.splice(j, 1);
870           changed = true;
871         }
872         else {
873           j++;
874         }
875       }
876     }
877   }
878   else if (this.selection) {
879     // remove all selections
880     for (var i = 0, iMax = this.selection.length; i < iMax; i++) {
881       var row = this.selection[i].row;
882       this.nodes[row].unselect();
883       changed = true;
884     }
885     this.selection = [];
886   }
887 
888   if (changed && (triggerSelect == true || triggerSelect == undefined)) {
889     // fire the select event
890     this.trigger('select');  
891   }
892 
893   return changed;
894 }
895 
896 /**
897  * select all nodes on given location x, y
898  * @param {Array} selection   an array with selection objects. Each selection
899  *                            object has a parameter row
900  * @param {boolean} append    If true, the new selection will be appended to the 
901  *                            current selection (except for duplicate entries)
902  * @param {Boolean} changed   True if the selection is changed
903  */ 
904 links.Network.prototype._selectNodes = function(selection, append) {
905   var changed = false;
906 
907   // TODO: the selectNodes method is a little messy, rework this
908 
909   // check if the current selection equals the desired selection
910   var selectionAlreadyDone = true;
911   if (selection.length != this.selection.length) {
912     selectionAlreadyDone = false;
913   }
914   else {
915     for (var i = 0, iMax = Math.min(selection.length, this.selection.length); i < iMax; i++) {
916       if (selection[i].row != this.selection[i].row) {
917         selectionAlreadyDone = false;
918         break;
919       }
920     }
921   }
922   if (selectionAlreadyDone) {
923     return;
924   }
925 
926   if (append == undefined || append == false) {
927     // first unselect any selected node
928     var triggerSelect = false;
929     changed = this._unselectNodes(undefined, triggerSelect);
930   }
931 
932   for (var i = 0, iMax = selection.length; i < iMax; i++) {    
933     // add each of the new selections, but only when they are not duplicate
934     var row = selection[i].row;
935     var isDuplicate = false;
936     for (var j = 0, jMax = this.selection.length; j < jMax; j++) {      
937       if (this.selection[j].row == row) {
938         isDuplicate = true;
939         break;
940       }
941     }
942 
943     if (!isDuplicate) {
944       this.nodes[row].select();
945       this.selection.push(selection[i]);
946       changed = true;
947     }
948   }
949 
950   if (changed) {
951     // fire the select event
952     this.trigger('select');  
953   }
954   
955   return changed;
956 }
957 
958 /**
959  * retrieve all nodes overlapping with given object
960  * @param {Object} obj           An object with parameters left, top, right, bottom
961  * @return {Array with objects}  An array with selection objects containing
962  *                               the parameter row.
963  */ 
964 links.Network.prototype._getNodesOverlappingWith = function (obj) {
965   var overlappingNodes = [];
966   
967   for (var i = 0; i < this.nodes.length; i++) {
968     if (this.nodes[i].isOverlappingWith(obj)) {
969       var sel = {"row": i};
970       overlappingNodes.push(sel);
971     }
972   }
973 
974   return overlappingNodes;
975 }
976 
977 /**
978  * retrieve the currently selected nodes
979  * @return {Array with objects} an array with zero or more objects. Each object
980  *                              contains the parameter row
981  */ 
982 links.Network.prototype.getSelection = function() {
983   var selection = [];
984   
985   for (var i = 0; i < this.selection.length; i++) {
986     var row = this.selection[i].row;
987     selection.push({"row": row});
988   }
989 
990   return selection;
991 }
992 
993 /**
994  * select zero or more nodes
995  * @param {Array with objects}  an array with zero or more objects. Each object
996  *                              contains the parameter row
997  */ 
998 links.Network.prototype.setSelection = function(selection) {
999   if (selection.length == undefined)
1000     throw "Selection must be an array with objects";
1001 
1002   // first unselect any selected node
1003   for (var i = 0, iMax = this.selection.length; i < iMax; i++) {    
1004     var row = this.selection[i].row;
1005     this.nodes[row].unselect();
1006   }
1007   
1008   this.selection = [];
1009   
1010   for (var i = 0, iMax = selection.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1011     var row = selection[i].row;
1012     
1013     if (row == undefined)
1014       throw "Parameter row missing in selection object";
1015     if (row > this.nodes.length-1)
1016       throw "Parameter row out of range";
1017     
1018     var sel = {"row": row};
1019     this.selection.push(sel); 
1020     this.nodes[row].select();
1021   }
1022   
1023   this.redraw();
1024 }

1027 /**
1028  * Temporary method to test calculating a hub value for the nodes
1029  * @param {number} level        Maximum number links between two nodes in order 
1030  *                              to call them connected. Optional, 1 by default
1031  * @return {Array with numbers} connectioncount, array with the connection count 
1032  *                              for each node
1033  */ 
1034 links.Network.prototype._getConnectionCount = function(level) {
1035   var conn = this.links;
1036   if (level == undefined) {
1037     level = 1;
1038   }
1039   
1040   // get the nodes connected to given nodes
1041   function getConnectedNodes(nodes) {
1042     var connectedNodes = [];
1043     
1044     for (var j = 0, jMax = nodes.length; j < jMax; j++) {
1045       var node = nodes[j];
1046 
1047       // find all nodes connected to this node
1048       for (var i = 0, iMax = conn.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1049         var other = null;
1050 
1051         // check if connected
1052         if (conn[i].from == node)
1053           other = conn[i].to;
1054         else if (conn[i].to == node)
1055           other = conn[i].from;
1056         
1057         // check if the other node is not already in the list with nodes
1058         if (other) {
1059           for (var k = 0, kMax = nodes.length; k < kMax; k++) {
1060             if (nodes[k] == other) {
1061               other = null;
1062               break;
1063             }
1064           }
1065         }
1066         if (other) {
1067           for (var k = 0, kMax = connectedNodes.length; k < kMax; k++) {
1068             if (connectedNodes[k] == other) {
1069               other = null;
1070               break;
1071             }
1072           }
1073         }
1074         
1075         if (other)
1076           connectedNodes.push(other);
1077       }
1078     }
1079     
1080     return connectedNodes;
1081   }
1082   
1083   var connections = [];
1084   var level0 = [];
1085   var nodes = this.nodes;
1086   for (var i = 0, iMax = nodes.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1087     var c = [nodes[i]];
1088     for (var l = 0; l < level; l++) {
1089       var c = c.concat(getConnectedNodes(c));
1090     }
1091     connections.push(c);
1092   }
1093   
1094   var hubs = [];
1095   for (var i = 0, len = connections.length; i < len; i++) {
1096     hubs.push(connections[i].length);
1097   }
1098   
1099   return hubs;
1100 }

1125 /**
1126  * Convert a Google DataTable to a Javascript Array
1127  * @param {google.visualization.DataTable} table
1128  * @return {Array} array
1129  */ 
1130 links.Network.tableToArray = function(table) {
1131   var array = [];
1132 
1133   // read the column names
1134   var colCount = table.getNumberOfColumns();
1135   var cols = {};
1136   for (var col = 0; col < colCount; col++) {
1137     var label = table.getColumnLabel(col);
1138     cols[label] = col;
1139   }
1140 
1141   var rowCount = table.getNumberOfRows();
1142   for (var i = 0; i < rowCount; i++) {
1143     // copy all properties from the table columns to an object
1144     var properties = {};
1145     for (var col in cols) {
1146       if (cols.hasOwnProperty(col)) {
1147         var value = table.getValue(i, cols[col]);
1148         properties[col] = value;
1149       }
1150     }
1151 
1152     array.push(properties);
1153   }
1154 
1155   return array;
1156 }

1158 
1159 /**
1160  * Append nodes 
1161  * Nodes with a duplicate id will be replaced
1162  * @param {google.visualization.DataTable or Array}   nodesTable  The data containing the nodes. 
1163  */ 
1164 links.Network.prototype.addNodes = function(nodesTable) {
1165   var table;
1166   if (google && google.visualization && google.visualization.DataTable &&
1167       nodesTable instanceof google.visualization.DataTable) {
1168     // Google DataTable. 
1169     // Convert to a Javascript Array
1170     table = links.Network.tableToArray(nodesTable);
1171   }
1172   else if (links.Network.isArray(nodesTable)){
1173     // Javascript Array
1174     table = nodesTable;
1175   }
1176   else {
1177     return;
1178   }
1179 
1180   var hasValues = false;
1181   var rowCount = table.length;
1182   for (var i = 0; i < rowCount; i++) {
1183     var properties = table[i];
1184     
1185     if (properties.value != undefined) {
1186       hasValues = true;
1187     }
1188     if (properties.id == undefined) {
1189       throw "Column 'id' missing in table with nodes (row " + i + ")";
1190     };
1191 
1192     this._createNode(properties);
1193   }
1194 
1195   // calculate scaling function when value is provided
1196   if (hasValues) {
1197     this._updateValueRange(this.nodes);
1198   }
1199 
1200   this.start();
1201 }
1202 
1203 /**
1204  * Load all nodes by reading the data table nodesTable
1205  * Note that Object DataTable is defined in google.visualization.DataTable
1206  * @param {google.visualization.DataTable or Array} nodesTable    The data containing the nodes. 
1207  */ 
1208 links.Network.prototype.setNodes = function(nodesTable) {
1209   var table;
1210   if (google && google.visualization && google.visualization.DataTable &&
1211       nodesTable instanceof google.visualization.DataTable) {
1212     // Google DataTable. 
1213     // Convert to a Javascript Array
1214     table = links.Network.tableToArray(nodesTable);
1215   }
1216   else if (links.Network.isArray(nodesTable)){
1217     // Javascript Array
1218     table = nodesTable;
1219   }
1220   else {
1221     return;
1222   }
1223 
1224   this.hasMovingNodes = false;
1225   this.nodesTable = table;
1226   this.nodes = [];
1227   this.selection = [];
1228 
1229   var hasValues = false;
1230   var rowCount = table.length;
1231   for (var i = 0; i < rowCount; i++) {
1232     var properties = table[i];
1233     
1234     if (properties.value != undefined) {
1235       hasValues = true;
1236     }
1237     if (properties.timestamp) {
1238       this.hasTimestamps = this.hasTimestamps || properties.timestamp;
1239     }
1240     if (properties.id == undefined) {
1241       throw "Column 'id' missing in table with nodes (row " + i + ")";
1242     }
1243     this._createNode(properties);
1244   }
1245 
1246   // calculate scaling function when value is provided
1247   if (hasValues) {
1248     this._updateValueRange(this.nodes);
1249   }
1250 }
1251 
1252 /**
1253  * Filter the current nodes table for nodes with a timestamp older than given
1254  * timestamp. Can only be used for nodes added via setNodes(), not via
1255  * addNodes().
1256  * @param {any type}    timestamp    Optional. If timestamp is undefined, all
1257  *                                   nodes are shown
1258  */ 
1259 links.Network.prototype._filterNodes = function(timestamp) {
1260   if (this.nodesTable == undefined) {
1261     return;
1262   }
1263 
1264   // remove existing nodes with a too new timestamp
1265   if (timestamp !== undefined) {
1266     var ns = this.nodes;
1267     var n = 0;
1268     while (n < ns.length) {
1269       var t = ns[n].timestamp;
1270       if (t !== undefined && t > timestamp) {
1271         // remove this node
1272         ns.splice(n, 1);
1273       }
1274       else {
1275         n++;
1276       }
1277     }
1278   }
1279   
1280   // add all nodes with an old enough timestamp
1281   var table = this.nodesTable;
1282   var rowCount = table.length;
1283   for (var i = 0; i < rowCount; i++) {
1284     // copy all properties
1285     var properties = table[i];
1286     
1287     if (properties.id === undefined) {
1288       throw "Column 'id' missing in table with nodes (row " + i + ")";
1289     }
1290     
1291     // check what the timestamp is
1292     var ts = properties.timestamp ? properties.timestamp : undefined;
1293     
1294     var visible = true;
1295     if (ts !== undefined && timestamp !== undefined && ts > timestamp) {
1296       visible = false;
1297     }
1298 
1299     if (visible) {
1300       // create or update the node
1301       this._createNode(properties);
1302     }
1303   }
1304   
1305   this.start();
1306 }
1307 
1308 /**
1309  * Create a node with the given properties
1310  * If the new node has an id identical to an existing package, the existing
1311  * node will be overwritten.
1312  * The properties can contain a property "action", which can have values 
1313  * "create", "update", or "delete"
1314  * @param {Object}   An object with properties
1315  */ 
1316 links.Network.prototype._createNode = function(properties) {
1317   var action = properties.action ? properties.action : "update";
1318 
1319   if (action === "create") {
1320     // create the node
1321     var newNode = new links.Network.Node(properties, this.images, this.groups, this.constants);
1322     var id = properties.id;
1323     var index = (id !== undefined) ? this._findNode(id) : undefined;
1324 
1325     if (index !== undefined) {
1326       // replace node
1327       this.nodes[index] = newNode;
1328     }
1329     else {
1330       // add new node
1331       this.nodes.push(newNode);
1332     }
1333     
1334     if (!newNode.isFixed()) {
1335       // note: no not use node.isMoving() here, as that gives the current
1336       // velocity of the node, which is zero after creation of the node.
1337       this.hasMovingNodes = true;
1338     }
1339   }
1340   else if (action === "update") {
1341     // update existing node, or create it when not yet existing
1342     var id = properties.id;
1343     if (id === undefined) {
1344       throw "Cannot update a node without id";
1345     }
1346 
1347     var index = this._findNode(id);
1348     if (index !== undefined) {
1349       // update node
1350       this.nodes[index].setProperties(properties);
1351     }
1352     else {
1353       // create node
1354       var newNode = new links.Network.Node(properties, this.images, this.groups, this.constants);
1355       this.nodes.push(newNode);
1356 
1357       if (!newNode.isFixed()) {
1358         // note: no not use node.isMoving() here, as that gives the current
1359         // velocity of the node, which is zero after creation of the node.
1360         this.hasMovingNodes = true;
1361       }
1362     }
1363   }  
1364   else if (action === "delete") {
1365     // delete existing node
1366     var id = properties.id;
1367     if (id === undefined) {
1368       throw "Cannot delete node without its id";
1369     }
1370 
1371     var index = this._findNode(id);
1372     if (index !== undefined) {
1373       this.nodes.splice(index, 1);
1374     }
1375     else {
1376       throw "Node with id " + id + " not found";      
1377     }
1378   }
1379   else {
1380     throw "Unknown action " + action + ". Choose 'create', 'update', or 'delete'.";
1381   }  
1382 }
1383 
1384 /**
1385  * Find a node by its id
1386  * @param {Number} id       Id of the node
1387  * @return {Number} index   Index of the node in the array this.nodes, or 
1388  *                          undefined when not found. * 
1389  */ 
1390 links.Network.prototype._findNode = function (id) {
1391   var nodes = this.nodes;
1392   for (var n = 0, len = nodes.length; n < len; n++) {
1393     if (nodes[n].id === id) {
1394       return n;
1395     }
1396   }
1397 
1398   return undefined;
1399 }

1401 
1402 /**
1403  * Load links by reading the data table
1404  * Note that Object DataTable is defined in google.visualization.DataTable
1405  * @param {google.visualization.DataTable or Array}      linksTable    The data containing the links. 
1406  */ 
1407 links.Network.prototype.setLinks = function(linksTable) {
1408   var table;
1409   if (google && google.visualization && google.visualization.DataTable &&
1410       linksTable instanceof google.visualization.DataTable) {
1411     // Google DataTable. 
1412     // Convert to a Javascript Array
1413     table = links.Network.tableToArray(linksTable);
1414   }
1415   else if (links.Network.isArray(linksTable)){
1416     // Javascript Array
1417     table = linksTable;
1418   }
1419   else {
1420     return;
1421   }
1422   
1423   this.linksTable = table;
1424   this.links = [];
1425   this.hasMovingLinks = false;
1426 
1427   var hasValues = false;
1428   var rowCount = table.length;
1429   for (var i = 0; i < rowCount; i++) {
1430     var properties = table[i];
1431     
1432     if (properties.from === undefined) {
1433       throw "Column 'from' missing in table with links (row " + i + ")";
1434     }
1435     if (properties.to === undefined) {
1436       throw "Column 'to' missing in table with links (row " + i + ")";
1437     }
1438     if (properties.timestamp != undefined) {
1439       this.hasTimestamps = this.hasTimestamps || properties.timestamp;
1440     }
1441     if (properties.value != undefined) {
1442       hasValues = true;
1443     }
1444     
1445     this._createLink(properties);
1446   }
1447   
1448   // calculate scaling function when value is provided
1449   if (hasValues) {
1450     this._updateValueRange(this.links);
1451   }  
1452 }
1453 
1454 
1455 /**
1456  * Load links by reading the data table
1457  * Note that Object DataTable is defined in google.visualization.DataTable
1458  * @param {google.visualization.DataTable or Array}      linksTable    The data containing the links. 
1459  */ 
1460 links.Network.prototype.addLinks = function(linksTable) {
1461   var table;
1462   if (google && google.visualization && google.visualization.DataTable &&
1463       linksTable instanceof google.visualization.DataTable) {
1464     // Google DataTable. 
1465     // Convert to a Javascript Array
1466     table = links.Network.tableToArray(linksTable);
1467   }
1468   else if (links.Network.isArray(linksTable)){
1469     // Javascript Array
1470     table = linksTable;
1471   }
1472   else {
1473     return;
1474   }
1475 
1476   var hasValues = false;
1477   var rowCount = table.length;
1478   for (var i = 0; i < rowCount; i++) {
1479     // copy all properties
1480     var properties = table[i];
1481 
1482     if (properties.from === undefined) {
1483       throw "Column 'from' missing in table with links (row " + i + ")";
1484     }
1485     if (properties.to === undefined) {
1486       throw "Column 'to' missing in table with links (row " + i + ")";
1487     }
1488     if (properties.value != undefined) {
1489       hasValues = true;
1490     }
1491     
1492     this._createLink(properties);
1493   }
1494   
1495   // calculate scaling function when value is provided
1496   if (hasValues) {
1497     this._updateValueRange(this.links);
1498   }  
1499   
1500   this.start();
1501 }
1502 
1503 
1504 /**
1505  * Filter the current links table for links with a timestamp below given
1506  * timestamp. Can only be used for links added via setLinks(), not via
1507  * addLinks().
1508  * @param {any type}    timestamp    Optional. If timestamp is undefined, all
1509  *                                   links are shown
1510  */ 
1511 links.Network.prototype._filterLinks = function(timestamp) {
1512   if (this.linksTable == undefined) {
1513     return;
1514   }
1515   
1516   // remove existing packages with a too new timestamp
1517   if (timestamp !== undefined) {
1518     var ls = this.links;
1519     var l = 0;
1520     while (l < ls.length) {
1521       var t = ls[l].timestamp;
1522       if (t !== undefined && t > timestamp) {
1523         // remove this link
1524         ls.splice(l, 1);
1525       }
1526       else {
1527         l++;
1528       }
1529     }
1530   }
1531   
1532   // add all links with an old enough timestamp
1533   var table = this.linksTable;
1534   var rowCount = table.length;
1535   for (var i = 0; i < rowCount; i++) {
1536     var properties = table[i];
1537     
1538     if (properties.from === undefined) {
1539       throw "Column 'from' missing in table with links (row " + i + ")";
1540     }
1541     if (properties.to === undefined) {
1542       throw "Column 'to' missing in table with links (row " + i + ")";
1543     }
1544 
1545     // check what the timestamp is
1546     var ts = properties.timestamp ? properties.timestamp : undefined;
1547     
1548     var visible = true;
1549     if (ts !== undefined && timestamp !== undefined && ts > timestamp) {
1550       visible = false;
1551     }
1552 
1553     if (visible) {
1554       // create or update the link
1555       this._createLink(properties);
1556     }
1557   }
1558     
1559   this.start();
1560 }
1561 
1562 /**
1563  * Create a link with the given properties
1564  * If the new link has an id identical to an existing link, the existing
1565  * link will be overwritten or updated.
1566  * The properties can contain a property "action", which can have values 
1567  * "create", "update", or "delete"
1568  * @param {Object}   An object with properties
1569  */ 
1570 links.Network.prototype._createLink = function(properties) {
1571   var action = properties.action ? properties.action : "create";
1572 
1573   if (action === "create") {
1574     // create the link, or replace it if already existing
1575     var id = properties.id;
1576     var index = (id !== undefined) ? this._findLink(id) : undefined;
1577     var link = new links.Network.Link(properties, this, this.constants);
1578 
1579     if (index !== undefined) {
1580       // replace existing link
1581       this.links[index] = link;
1582     }
1583     else {
1584       // add new link
1585       this.links.push(link);
1586     }
1587     
1588     if (link.isMoving()) {
1589       this.hasMovingLinks = true;
1590     }
1591   }
1592   else if (action === "update") {
1593     // update existing link, or create the link if not existing
1594     var id = properties.id;
1595     if (id === undefined) {
1596       throw "Cannot update a link without id";
1597     }
1598 
1599     var index = this._findLink(id);
1600     if (index !== undefined) {
1601       // update link
1602       var link = this.links[index];
1603       link.setProperties(properties);
1604     }
1605     else {
1606       // add new link
1607       var link = new links.Network.Link(properties, this, this.constants);
1608       this.links.push(link);
1609       if (link.isMoving()) {
1610         this.hasMovingLinks = true;
1611       }    
1612     }
1613   }
1614   else if (action === "delete") {
1615     // delete existing link
1616     var id = properties.id;
1617     if (id === undefined) {
1618       throw "Cannot delete link without its id";
1619     }
1620 
1621     var index = this._findLink(id);
1622     if (index !== undefined) {
1623       this.links.splice(index, 1);
1624     }
1625     else {
1626       throw "Link with id " + id + " not found";      
1627     }
1628   }
1629   else {
1630     throw "Unknown action " + action + ". Choose 'create', 'update', or 'delete'.";
1631   }  
1632 }
1633 
1634 /**
1635  * Update the link to oldNode in all links and packages.
1636  * @param {Node} oldNode
1637  * @param {Node} newNode
1638  */ 
1639 // TODO: start utilizing this method _updateNodeReferences
1640 links.Network.prototype._updateNodeReferences = function(oldNode, newNode) {
1641   var arrays = [this.links, this.packages];
1642   for (var a = 0, aMax = arrays.length; a < aMax; a++) {
1643     var array = arrays[a];
1644     for (var i = 0, iMax = array.length; i < iMax; i++) {
1645       if (array.from === oldNode) {
1646         array.from = newNode;
1647       }
1648       if (array.to === oldNode) {
1649         array.to = newNode;
1650       }
1651     }
1652   }
1653 }

1655 /**
1656  * Find a link by its id
1657  * @param {Number} id       Id of the link
1658  * @return {Number} index   Index of the link in the array this.links, or 
1659  *                          undefined when not found. * 
1660  */ 
1661 links.Network.prototype._findLink = function (id) {
1662   var links = this.links;
1663   for (var n = 0, len = links.length; n < len; n++) {
1664     if (links[n].id === id) {
1665       return n;
1666     }
1667   }
1668 
1669   return undefined;
1670 }

1674  * Append packages 
1675  * Packages with a duplicate id will be replaced
1676  * Note that Object DataTable is defined in google.visualization.DataTable
1677  * @param {google.visualization.DataTable or Array}   packagesTable    The data containing the packages. 
1678  */ 
1679 links.Network.prototype.addPackages = function(packagesTable) {
1680   var table;
1681   if (google && google.visualization && google.visualization.DataTable &&
1682       packagesTable instanceof google.visualization.DataTable) {
1683     // Google DataTable. 
1684     // Convert to a Javascript Array
1685     table = links.Network.tableToArray(packagesTable);
1686   }
1687   else if (links.Network.isArray(packagesTable)){
1688     // Javascript Array
1689     table = packagesTable;
1690   }
1691   else {
1692     return;
1693   }
1694 
1695   var rowCount = table.length;
1696   for (var i = 0; i < rowCount; i++) {
1697     var properties = table[i];
1698 
1699     if (properties.from === undefined) {
1700       throw "Column 'from' missing in table with packages (row " + i + ")";
1701     }
1702     if (properties.to === undefined) {
1703       throw "Column 'to' missing in table with packages (row " + i + ")";
1704     }
1705     
1706     this._createPackage(properties);
1707   }
1708   
1709   // calculate scaling function when value is provided
1710   this._updateValueRange(this.packages);
1711   
1712   this.start();

1715 /**
1716  * Set a new packages table
1717  * Packages with a duplicate id will be replaced
1718  * Note that Object DataTable is defined in google.visualization.DataTable
1719  * @param {google.visualization.DataTable or Array}   packagesTable    The data containing the packages. 
1720  */ 
1721 links.Network.prototype.setPackages = function(packagesTable) {
1722   var table;
1723   if (google && google.visualization && google.visualization.DataTable &&
1724       packagesTable instanceof google.visualization.DataTable) {
1725     // Google DataTable. 
1726     // Convert to a Javascript Array
1727     table = links.Network.tableToArray(packagesTable);
1728   }
1729   else if (links.Network.isArray(packagesTable)){
1730     // Javascript Array
1731     table = packagesTable;
1732   }
1733   else {
1734     return;
1735   }
1736   
1737   this.packagesTable = table;
1738   this.packages = [];
1739 
1740   var rowCount = table.length;
1741   for (var i = 0; i < rowCount; i++) {
1742     var properties = table[i];
1743 
1744     if (properties.from === undefined) {
1745       throw "Column 'from' missing in table with packages (row " + i + ")";
1746     }
1747     if (properties.to === undefined) {
1748       throw "Column 'to' missing in table with packages (row " + i + ")";
1749     }
1750     if (properties.timestamp) {
1751       this.hasTimestamps = this.hasTimestamps || properties.timestamp;
1752     }
1753     
1754     this._createPackage(properties);
1755   }
1756   
1757   // calculate scaling function when value is provided
1758   this._updateValueRange(this.packages);
1759   
1760   /* TODO: adjust examples and documentation for this?
1761   this.start();
1762   */
1763 }

1765 /**
1766  * Filter the current package table for packages with a timestamp below given
1767  * timestamp. Can only be used for packages added via setPackages(), not via
1768  * addPackages().
1769  * @param {any type}    timestamp    Optional. If timestamp is undefined, all
1770  *                                   packages are shown
1771  */ 
1772 links.Network.prototype._filterPackages = function(timestamp) {
1773   if (this.packagesTable == undefined) {
1774     return;
1775   }
1776   
1777   // remove all current packages
1778   this.packages = [];
1779   
1780   /* TODO: cleanup
1781   // remove existing packages with a too new timestamp
1782   if (timestamp !== undefined) {
1783     var packages = this.packages;
1784     var p = 0;
1785     while (p < packages.length) {
1786       var package = packages[p];
1787       var t = package.timestamp;
1788       
1789       if (t !== undefined &&  t > timestamp ) {
1790         // remove this package
1791         packages.splice(p, 1);
1792       }
1793       else {
1794         p++;
1795       }
1796     }
1797   }
1798   */
1799   
1800   // add all packages with an old enough timestamp
1801   var table = this.packagesTable;
1802   var rowCount = table.length;
1803   for (var i = 0; i < rowCount; i++) {
1804     var properties = table[i];
1805     
1806     if (properties.from === undefined) {
1807       throw "Column 'from' missing in table with packages (row " + i + ")";
1808     }
1809     if (properties.to === undefined) {
1810       throw "Column 'to' missing in table with packages (row " + i + ")";
1811     }
1812     // check what the timestamp is
1813     var pTimestamp = properties.timestamp ? properties.timestamp : undefined;
1814     
1815     var visible = true;
1816     if (pTimestamp !== undefined && timestamp !== undefined && pTimestamp > timestamp) {
1817       visible = false;
1818     }
1819     
1820     if (visible === true) {
1821       if (properties.progress == undefined) {
1822         // when no progress is provided, we need to add our own progress
1823         var duration = properties.duration || this.constants.packages.duration; // seconds
1824 
1825         var diff = (timestamp.getTime() - pTimestamp.getTime()) / 1000; // seconds
1826         if (diff < duration) {
1827           // copy the properties, and fill in the current progress based on the
1828           // timestamp and the duration
1829           var original = properties;
1830           var properties = {};
1831           for (var i in original) {
1832             if (original.hasOwnProperty(i)) {
1833               properties[i] = original[i];
1834             }
1835           }
1836           
1837           properties.progress = diff / duration;  // scale 0-1
1838         } 
1839         else {
1840           visible = false;
1841         }
1842       }
1843     }
1844 
1845     if (visible === true) {
1846       // create or update the package
1847       this._createPackage(properties);
1848     }
1849   }
1850   
1851   this.start();
1852 }
1853 
1854 /**
1855  * Create a package with the given properties
1856  * If the new package has an id identical to an existing package, the existing
1857  * package will be overwritten.
1858  * The properties can contain a property "action", which can have values 
1859  * "create", "update", or "delete"
1860  * @param {Object}   An object with properties
1861  */ 
1862 links.Network.prototype._createPackage = function(properties) {
1863   var action = properties.action ? properties.action : "create";
1864 
1865   if (action === "create") {
1866     // create the package
1867     var id = properties.id;
1868     var index = (id !== undefined) ? this._findPackage(id) : undefined;
1869     var newPackage = new links.Network.Package(properties, this, this.images, this.constants);
1870     
1871     if (index !== undefined) {
1872       // replace existing package
1873       this.packages[index] = newPackage;
1874     }
1875     else {
1876       // add new package
1877       this.packages.push(newPackage);
1878     }
1879     
1880     if (newPackage.isMoving()) {
1881       this.hasMovingPackages = true;
1882     }
1883   }
1884   else if (action === "update") {
1885     // update a package, or create it when not existing
1886     var id = properties.id;
1887     if (id === undefined) {
1888       throw "Cannot update a link without id";
1889     }
1890 
1891     var index = this._findPackage(id);      
1892     if (index !== undefined) {
1893       // update existing package 
1894       this.packages[index].setProperties(properties);
1895     }
1896     else {
1897       // add new package
1898       var newPackage = new links.Network.Package(properties, this, this.images, this.constants);
1899       this.packages.push(newPackage);
1900       if (newPackage.isMoving()) {
1901         this.hasMovingPackages = true;
1902       }
1903     }
1904   }
1905   else if (action === "delete") {
1906     // delete existing package
1907     var id = properties.id;
1908     if (id === undefined) {
1909       throw "Cannot delete package without its id";
1910     }
1911 
1912     var index = this._findPackage(id);      
1913     if (index !== undefined) {
1914       this.packages.splice(index, 1);
1915     }
1916     else {
1917       throw "Package with id " + id + " not found";      
1918     }
1919   }
1920   else {
1921     throw "Unknown action " + action + ". Choose 'create', 'update', or 'delete'.";
1922   }  
1923 }
1924 
1925 /**
1926  * Find a package by its id.
1927  * @param {Number} id
1928  * @return {Number} index    Index of the package in the array this.packages,
1929  *                           or undefined when not found
1930  */ 
1931 links.Network.prototype._findPackage = function (id) {
1932   var packages = this.packages;
1933   for (var n = 0, len = packages.length; n < len; n++) {
1934     if (packages[n].id === id) {
1935       return n;
1936     }
1937   }
1938 
1939   return undefined;
1940 }

1942 /**
1943  * Retrieve an object which maps the column ids by their names
1944  * For example a table with columns [id, name, value] will return an 
1945  * object {"id": 0, "name": 1, "value": 2}
1946  * @param {DataTable} table    A google datatable
1947  * @return {Object} columnIds   An object
1948  */ 
1949 // TODO: cleanup this unused method
1950 links.Network.prototype._getColumnNames = function (table) {
1951   var colCount = table.getNumberOfColumns();
1952   var cols = {};
1953   for (var col = 0; col < colCount; col++) {
1954     var label = table.getColumnLabel(col);
1955     cols[label] = col;
1956   }
1957   return cols;
1958 }

1961 /**
1962  * Update the values of all object in the given array according to the current 
1963  * value range of the objects in the array.
1964  * @param {Array} array.  An array with objects like Links, Nodes, or Packages
1965  *                        The objects must have a method getValue() and 
1966  *                        setValueRange(min, max).
1967  */ 
1968 links.Network.prototype._updateValueRange = function(array) {
1969   var count = array.length;
1970   
1971   // determine the range of the node values
1972   var valueMin = undefined;
1973   var valueMax = undefined;
1974   for (var i = 0; i < count; i++) {
1975     var value = array[i].getValue();
1976     if (value !== undefined) {
1977       valueMin = (valueMin === undefined) ? value : Math.min(value, valueMin);
1978       valueMax = (valueMax === undefined) ? value : Math.max(value, valueMax);
1979     }
1980   }
1981 
1982   // adjust the range of all nodes
1983   if (valueMin !== undefined && valueMax !== undefined) {
1984     for (var i = 0; i < count; i++) {
1985       array[i].setValueRange(valueMin, valueMax);
1986     }      
1987   }
1988 }

1993  * than the given timestamp will be drawn.
1994  * @param {Date or number} timestamp
1995  */ 
1996 links.Network.prototype.setTimestamp = function(timestamp) {
1997   this._filterNodes(timestamp);
1998   this._filterLinks(timestamp);
1999   this._filterPackages(timestamp);
2000 }

2003 /**
2004  * Get the range of all timestamps defined in the nodes, links and packages
2005  * @return {Object}   A range object, containing parameters start and end.
2006  */ 
2007 links.Network.prototype._getRange = function() {
2008   // range is stored as number. at the end of the method, it is converted to
2009   // Date when needed.
2010   var range = {
2011     "start": undefined, 
2012     "end": undefined
2013   };
2014 
2015   var tables = [this.nodesTable, this.linksTable];
2016   for (var t = 0, tMax = tables.length; t < tMax; t++) {
2017     var table = tables[t];
2018     
2019     if (table !== undefined) {
2020       for (var i = 0, iMax = table.length; i < iMax; i++) {
2021         var timestamp = table[i].timestamp;
2022         if (timestamp) {
2023           // to long
2024           if (timestamp instanceof Date) {
2025             timestamp = timestamp.getTime();
2026           }
2027           
2028           // calculate new range
2029           range.start = range.start ? Math.min(timestamp, range.start) : timestamp;
2030           range.end = range.end ? Math.max(timestamp, range.end) : timestamp;
2031         }
2032       } 
2033     }
2034   }
2035 
2036   // calculate the range for the packagesTable by hand. In case of packages
2037   // without a progress provided, we need to calculate the end time by hand.
2038   if (this.packagesTable) {
2039     var packagesTable = this.packagesTable;
2040     for (var row = 0, len = packagesTable.length; row < len; row ++) {
2041       var pkg = packagesTable[row],
2042           timestamp = pkg.timestamp,
2043           progress = pkg.progress,
2044           duration = pkg.duration || this.constants.packages.duration;
2045 
2046       // convert to number
2047       if (timestamp instanceof Date) {
2048         timestamp = timestamp.getTime();
2049       }
2050 
2051       if (timestamp != undefined) {
2052         var start = timestamp,
2053             end = progress ? timestamp : (timestamp + duration * 1000);
2054 
2055         range.start = range.start ? Math.min(start, range.start) : start;
2056         range.end = range.end ? Math.max(end, range.end) : end;
2057       }
2058     }
2059   }
2060 
2061   // convert to the right type: number or date
2062   var rangeFormat = {
2063     "start": new Date(range.start),
2064     "end": new Date(range.end)
2065   };    
2066 
2067   return rangeFormat;
2068 }

2135 /**
2136  * Redraw the network with the current data
2137  */ 
2138 links.Network.prototype._redraw = function() {
2139   var ctx = this.frame.canvas.getContext("2d");
2140   
2141   // clear the canvas
2142   var w = this.frame.canvas.width;
2143   var h = this.frame.canvas.height;
2144   ctx.clearRect(0, 0, w, h);
2145 
2146   // set scaling and translation
2147   ctx.save();
2148   ctx.translate(this.translation.x, this.translation.y);
2149   ctx.scale(this.scale, this.scale);
2150 
2151   this._drawLinks(ctx);
2152   this._drawNodes(ctx);
2153   this._drawPackages(ctx);
2154   this._drawSlider();
2155 
2156   // restore original scaling and translation
2157   ctx.restore();
2158 }
2159 
2160 /**
2161  * Set the translation of the network
2162  * @param {Number} offsetX    Horizontal offset
2163  * @param {Number} offsetY    Vertical offset
2164  */ 
2165 links.Network.prototype._setTranslation = function(offsetX, offsetY) {
2166   if (this.translation === undefined) {
2167     this.translation = {
2168       "x": 0, 
2169       "y": 0
2170     };
2171   }
2172   
2173   if (offsetX !== undefined) {
2174     this.translation.x = offsetX;
2175   }
2176   if (offsetY !== undefined) {
2177     this.translation.y = offsetY;
2178   }
2179 }

2181 /**
2182  * Get the translation of the network
2183  * @return {Object} translation    An object with parameters x and y, both a number
2184  */ 
2185 links.Network.prototype._getTranslation = function() {
2186   return {
2187     "x": this.translation.x,
2188     "y": this.translation.y
2189   };
2190 }

2192 /**
2193  * Scale the network
2194  * @param {Number} scale   Scaling factor 1.0 is unscaled
2195  */ 
2196 links.Network.prototype._setScale = function(scale) {
2197   this.scale = scale;
2198 }
2199 /**
2200  * Get the current scale of  the network
2201  * @return {Number} scale   Scaling factor 1.0 is unscaled
2202  */ 
2203 links.Network.prototype._getScale = function() {
2204   return this.scale;
2205 }
2206 
2207 links.Network.prototype._xToCanvas = function(x) {
2208   return (x - this.translation.x) / this.scale;
2209 }
2210 
2211 links.Network.prototype._canvasToX = function(x) {
2212   return x * this.scale + this.translation.x;
2213 }
2214 
2215 links.Network.prototype._yToCanvas = function(y) {
2216   return (y - this.translation.y) / this.scale;
2217 }
2218 
2219 links.Network.prototype._canvasToY = function(y) {
2220   return y * this.scale + this.translation.y ;
2221 }

2230 links.Network.prototype._getNode = function(id) {
2231   for (var i = 0; i < this.nodes.length; i++) {
2232     if (this.nodes[i].id == id)
2233       return this.nodes[i];
2234   }

2239 /**
2240  * Redraw all nodes
2241  * The 2d context of a HTML canvas can be retrieved by canvas.getContext("2d");
2242  * @param {CanvasRenderingContext2D}   ctx
2243  */ 
2244 links.Network.prototype._drawNodes = function(ctx) {  
2245   // first draw the unselected nodes
2246   var nodes = this.nodes;
2247   var selected = [];
2248   for (var i = 0, iMax = nodes.length; i < iMax; i++) {
2249     if (nodes[i].isSelected()) {
2250       selected.push(i);
2251     }
2252     else {
2253       nodes[i].draw(ctx);
2254     }
2255   }
2256 
2257   // draw the selected nodes on top
2258   for (var s = 0, sMax = selected.length; s < sMax; s++) {
2259     nodes[selected[s]].draw(ctx);
2260   }
2261 }

2268 links.Network.prototype._drawLinks = function(ctx) {
2269   var links = this.links;

2272   }

2395 /**
2396  * Find a stable position for all nodes
2397  */ 
2398 links.Network.prototype._doStabilize = function() {
2399   var start = new Date();
2400   
2401   // find stable position
2402   var count = 0;
2403   var vmin = this.constants.minVelocity;
2404   var stable = false;
2405   while (!stable && count < this.constants.maxIterations) {
2406     this._calculateForces();
2407     this._discreteStepNodes();
2408     stable = !this.isMoving(vmin);
2409     count++; 
2410   }
2411   
2412   var end = new Date();
2413   
2414   //console.log("Stabilized in " + (end-start) + " ms, " + count + " iterations" ); // TODO: cleanup
2415 }
2416 
2417 /**
2418  * Calculate the external forces acting on the nodes
2419  * Forces are caused by: links, repulsing forces between nodes, gravity
2420  */ 
2421 links.Network.prototype._calculateForces = function(nodeId) {
2422   // create a local link to the nodes and links, that is faster
2423   var nodes = this.nodes,
2424       links = this.links;
2425 
2426   // gravity, add a small constant force to pull the nodes towards the center of 
2427   // the graph 
2428   // Also, the forces are reset to zero in this loop by using _setForce instead
2429   // of _addForce
2430   var gravity = 0.01,
2431       gx = this.frame.canvas.clientWidth / 2,
2432       gy = this.frame.canvas.clientHeight / 2;
2433   for (var n = 0; n < nodes.length; n++) {
2434     var dx = gx - nodes[n].x,
2435         dy = gy - nodes[n].y,
2436         angle = Math.atan2(dy, dx),
2437         fx = Math.cos(angle) * gravity,
2438         fy = Math.sin(angle) * gravity;
2439 
2440     this.nodes[n]._setForce(fx, fy);
2441   } 
2442 
2443   // repulsing forces between nodes
2444   var minimumDistance = this.constants.nodes.distance,
2445       steepness = 10; // higher value gives steeper slope of the force around the given minimumDistance
2446   for (var n = 0; n < nodes.length; n++) {
2447     for (var n2 = n + 1; n2 < this.nodes.length; n2++) {
2448       //var dmin = (nodes[n].width + nodes[n].height + nodes[n2].width + nodes[n2].height) / 1 || minimumDistance, // TODO: dmin
2449       //var dmin = (nodes[n].width + nodes[n2].width)/2  || minimumDistance, // TODO: dmin
2450           //dmin = 40 + ((nodes[n].width/2 + nodes[n2].width/2) || 0),
2451           
2452           // calculate normally distributed force
2453       var dx = nodes[n2].x - nodes[n].x,
2454           dy = nodes[n2].y - nodes[n].y,
2455           distance = Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy),
2456           angle = Math.atan2(dy, dx),
2457           
2458           // TODO: correct factor for repulsing force
2459           //var repulsingforce = 2 * Math.exp(-5 * (distance * distance) / (dmin * dmin) ); // TODO: customize the repulsing force
2460           //repulsingforce = Math.exp(-1 * (distance * distance) / (dmin * dmin) ), // TODO: customize the repulsing force
2461           repulsingforce = 1 / (1 + Math.exp((distance / minimumDistance - 1) * steepness)), // TODO: customize the repulsing force
2462           fx = Math.cos(angle) * repulsingforce,
2463           fy = Math.sin(angle) * repulsingforce;
2464 
2465       this.nodes[n]._addForce(-fx, -fy);
2466       this.nodes[n2]._addForce(fx, fy);
2467     }
2468   }  
2469 
2470   // forces caused by the links, modelled as springs
2471   for (var l = 0, lMax = links.length; l < lMax; l++) {
2472     var link = links[l],
2473 
2474         dx = (link.to.x - link.from.x),
2475         dy = (link.to.y - link.from.y),
2476         //linkLength = (link.from.width + link.from.height + link.to.width + link.to.height)/2 || link.length, // TODO: dmin
2477         //linkLength = (link.from.width + link.to.width)/2 || link.length, // TODO: dmin
2478         //linkLength = 20 + ((link.from.width + link.to.width) || 0) / 2,
2479         linkLength = link.length,
2480         length =  Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy),
2481         angle = Math.atan2(dy, dx),
2482 
2483         springforce = link.stiffness * (linkLength - length),
2484         
2485         fx = Math.cos(angle) * springforce,
2486         fy = Math.sin(angle) * springforce;
2487 
2488     link.from._addForce(-fx, -fy);
2489     link.to._addForce(fx, fy);
2490   }
2491 }

2494 /**
2495  * Check if any of the nodes is still moving
2496  * @param {number} vmin   the minimum velocity considered as "moving"
2497  * @return {boolean}      true if moving, false if non of the nodes is moving
2498  */ 
2499 links.Network.prototype.isMoving = function(vmin) {
2500   // TODO: ismoving does not work well: should check the kinetic energy, not its velocity
2501   var nodes = this.nodes;
2502   for (var n = 0, nMax = nodes.length; n < nMax; n++) {
2503     if (nodes[n].isMoving(vmin))
2504       return true;
2505   }
2506   return false;
2507 }
